result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Le Yanna L Shackles

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Letter dated 10/28/2022, filed by Le Yanna Shackles, requesting a sooner court date

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 11/1/2022 - Okay to schedule.**
Signed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022

10:18 AM Defendant Le Yanna L Shackles in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Le Yanna L Shackles.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests to withdraw from case, pursuant to 10/03/2022 Motion filed by the Defense. Defendant confirms that she is asking to have Atty Klein withdrawn from her case. 
State notes that they are ready to proceed to trial at this time, but takes no position on request. 

Court will allow Atty Klein to withdraw from the case, and allow the PD's office to withdraw from the case. Court will set a status of counsel hearing. Court directs the Defendant to go to the PD's office to advise that new Attorney will have to be appointed. 

Court will take 10/25/2022 jury trial off of the Court's calendar. 

Defendant now advises that she wants to proceed pro-se. Court will set status hearing to allow the Defendant to decide how she wants to proceed re: her representation.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Proposed Order to Withdraw, filed by Atty Klein

filed by Atty Klein

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/03/2022 - Will address at 10/20/2022 Jury Status.**
State's Witness List
Signed by Judge Carter on 08/30/2022.

9:39 AM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Le Yanna L Shackles. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Authorization to appear received and filed. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received PTC offer, and requests to set for jury trial. Court sets.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   
Defendant Le Yanna L Shackles did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by authorization previously filed.

Defense still waiting on a pretrial offer.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

File not called on the record. Defendant Le Yanna L Shackles not in court with attorney Jessica A Klein. Atty Klein appears by Authorization.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Klein was just appointed, still needs to review discovery, asks for new date. 
  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Jessica Klein has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Motion to Withdraw as Counsel, filed by Attorney Mirza.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/10/2022 - Approved.**
Attorney Osman Mirza
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant previously posted cash bail on 03-25-2022

APPLY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT.  DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $295.00.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart.  Defendant is not to discuss the case with the co-defendant (Aaliyah T Simmons) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

09:25 AM Defendant Le Yanna L Shackles in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
